page.title: 18St.Andrew's Church Kingswood
page.content: Despite its{gothic}appearance St. Andrews Church was only built in 1852. The reason for the false impression: it was modelled on a genuine medieval church in Shottesbrooke, Berkshire. It was built under the direction of one Thomas Alcock who so much loved the church that he had it it copied in his own village of Kingswood. The building is dominated by a very large tower, traditionally placed at the crossing. On top of this stands an octagonal spire which stands out against the{Kingswood sky-line.}The tower houses a peal six C.and G.Mears bells, generally acknowledged as one of the best in Surrey. Three{services}are held each Sunday which are quite well attended. The parish and church is looked after by a{vicar}who lives in the Kingswood estate.
